titleStmt.title: J. H. Riley et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9064

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: His Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky your petitioners would respectfully represent that J H Marshall who has been convicted of Grand Larceny at the June term 1863 of the Marshall Circuit Court is a poor but hard working man and that he has a close family comprised of a wife & little children who need the proceeds of his service and labor for subsistence and to be short we think it would serve be greatly to the interest of his family and of no disadvantage to the public & society if he should be released from to confinement and therefore willingly recommend the case as one requiring Executive clemency

J. H. Riley
Ridley Morgan
A. A Edwards
M. M, Wood
H. S. Thompson
E. Graddy
W D Hunter
John M Philips
W. W. Gilbert
H Washburn
Jas M Henlen

Pettn from Marshall county to pard J H Marshall for larceny
